results.deck: Step into the shoes of real-life Navy SEAL legend Dick Marcinko in this foul-mouthed first-person shooter from Rebellion and Bethesda Softworks.
results.name: Rogue Warrior

results.deck: Defend against the alien attack on Moscow in this brawler/shooter from Targem and publisher Buka. As you progress you'll learn/earn special abilities, skills and characteristics from the alien invaders-- although at the cost of humanity and sanity.
results.name: MorphX

results.deck: TimeO is a an action adventure game about two New York City urban explorers who discover an entrance to a parallel world in which they must battle to survive encounters with armies of hostile robots and malevolent, ambulatory buildings.
results.name: TimeO

results.deck: The second installment in the Assassin's Creed franchise follows the life of Ezio Auditore da Firenze as he seeks revenge on those who betrayed his family.
results.name: Assassin's Creed II

results.deck: A steampunk-styled action-adventure from indie developer Fuzzyeyes Studio. In development since 2006, it has been delayed, cancelled, and uncancelled several times, and currently has no announced release date.
results.name: Edge of Twilight

results.deck: Splatterhouse revisits Rick Taylor as he tries to rescue his girlfriend Jennifer from the evil clutches of Dr. West.  In the process, he must battle against evil beings known as the "Corrupted" in bloody and brutal combat.
results.name: Splatterhouse

results.deck: Onechanbara: Bikini Samurai Squad is an action beat-em-up with light RPG elements from D3 in which you control two cursed sword wielding sisters slicing their way through a zombie infested city.
results.name: Onechanbara: Bikini Samurai Squad

results.deck: Heat was a video game coming to, "next generation platforms," based on the movie of the same name. Originally announced as a Gearbox developed title in 2006, development has since been put on hold.
results.name: Heat

results.deck: The Super Robot Wars series makes its way to the Nintendo GameCube. This time, you can target certain body parts on the enemy, opening up even more strategic options.
results.name: Super Robot Taisen GC

results.deck: Risen is an action-RPG from Piranha Bytes. It takes place on a tropical island.
results.name: Risen

results.deck: Based on the original television show, Battlestar Galactica is a space combat game pitting the ragtag Colonial army against the imperialistic Cylon centurions.
results.name: Battlestar Galactica

results.deck: Divinity 2 is a sequel to the action roleplaying games Divine Divinity and Beyond Divinity, with a new 3D engine replacing the previous isometric 2D engine.
results.name: Divinity II: Ego Draconis

results.deck: The second Samurai Warriors title sees an expanded roster and new selection of battlefields. Players fight through campaigns focused on historical figures of the Warring States era.
results.name: Samurai Warriors 2

results.deck: The Lord of the Rings: The White Council was an RPG in development at EA Redwood Shores (now Visceral Games), until its cancellation. The game was to be set in Middle-earth at a time before Bilbo Baggins discovers the One Ring.
results.name: The Lord of the Rings: The White Council

results.deck: Saw is a survival horror video game based on the popular movie franchise of the same name in which players will encounter familiar characters and solve puzzles to progress. Developed by Zombie Studios and published by Konami, the game runs on the Unreal Engine 3.
results.name: SAW

results.deck: Batman: Arkham Asylum puts you behind the cowl of the iconic Dark Knight, fighting his way through Arkham Asylum to stop the Joker from enacting a sinister plot that would have grave consequences for Gotham City.
results.name: Batman: Arkham Asylum

results.deck: Clannad is a visual novel developed by Key and released on April 2004 in Japan, first on the PC and later on the PS2 in 2006 and the PSP and Xbox 360 in 2008. With an acclaimed interactive narrative revolving around a family theme, it was adapted into an equally acclaimed anime series.
results.name: Clannad

results.deck: A spin-off of Clannad which expands on the story of Tomoyo Sakagami, one of the heroines of the original title. Features a strategy RPG mini-game which has its own story.
results.name: Tomoyo After: It's a Wonderful Life

results.deck: Shellshock 2: Blood Trails is the sequel to Guerrilla Game's Shellshock: Nam '67. It shifts the perspective to first-person and the genre to "survival horror." It takes place in Cambodia during the time of the Vietnam Conflict.
results.name: Shellshock 2: Blood Trails

results.deck: Dirty Harry (working title) was a game cited as coming to the Xbox360 and PS3, however the game has been significantly delayed and subsequently cancelled due to problems with the developer. Warner Bros. Interactive still intend to produce the game at a later date.
results.name: Dirty Harry

results.deck: A sequel to the classic 1988 strategy game Carrier Command, Gaea Mission is based on the second book of the Gaea Universe trilogy and is licensed and endorsed by the creators of the original game.
results.name: Carrier Command: Gaea Mission

results.deck: The sequel to Overlord, this is a unique and strategic Adventure game that allows control of an Overlord character who possesses mischief-making, loyal minions that bid his doing of evil or good.
results.name: Overlord II

results.deck: This open-world crime sequel follows the events of the second film and attempts to make you act like a mobster and think like a Don in the Godfather universe.
results.name: The Godfather II

results.deck: The long-awaited third Max Payne game finally arrived in May 2012, courtesy of Rockstar Vancouver. Eight years after the end of Max Payne 2, an aging, burnt-out Max finds one last chance to redeem himself while working as a bodyguard for a rich family in Brazil.
results.name: Max Payne 3

results.deck: Fuel is an open-world racing game featuring 5,000-plus miles of open road and drastic weather like tornados and blizzards.
results.name: FUEL

results.deck: Stoked is a trick-based open world snowboarding game with a focus on backcountry riding.
results.name: Stoked

results.deck: Dynasty Warriors: Gundam 2 is the sequel to Bandai and Koei's Gundam/Dynasty Warriors mash-up.
results.name: Dynasty Warriors: Gundam 2

results.deck: A cinematic action game for the Xbox 360, in a vein similar to Ninja Gaiden.
results.name: Ninja Blade

results.deck: Monster Hunter Frontier is a PC MMORPG featuring a new guild system, customizable homes, and new monsters to hunt.
results.name: Monster Hunter Frontier

results.deck: A crossover RPG featuring characters from Darkstalkers, Disgaea, Atelier Marie, Mana Khemia and many other series, with a turn-based combat system and costume-based "forms."
results.name: Cross Edge

results.deck: In this reboot of the beloved Castlevania franchise, Gabriel Belmont goes on a quest to defeat the sinister Lords of Shadow, who are preventing the souls of the departed from passing on to the afterlife, in order to obtain from them a magical mask that will bring his murdered wife Marie back from the dead.
results.name: Castlevania: Lords of Shadow

results.deck: A crucial planet size factory is under siege by millions of Orks. As Space Marine Captain Titus, you must lead your soldiers to stem the tide until help arrives.
results.name: Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine

results.deck: Join in the musical with the third title in the franchise.
results.name: High School Musical 3: Senior Year Dance!

results.deck: Explore and roam around new and official courses in my Horse & Me 2. Features multiplayer and customization options too.
results.name: My Horse & Me 2

results.deck: ArcaniA: Gothic 4 is the 4th installment in the European Action RPG franchise Gothic, and the first after JoWood's split with the original franchise developer.
results.name: Arcania: Gothic 4

results.deck: Tekken 6: Bloodline Rebellion is an updated version of Tekken 6 for arcades, which has also been ported to PS3, Xbox 360 and PSP. The home console releases have been released simply as "Tekken 6".
results.name: Tekken 6: Bloodline Rebellion

results.deck: This disc-based Rock Band pack brings downloadable content to those of you who can't (or won't) get it online.
results.name: Rock Band Track Pack Volume 2

results.deck: FreeStyleGames' DJ Hero uses a turntable controller to bring Guitar Hero-like gameplay to more genres and styles of music.
results.name: DJ Hero

results.deck: Secret Service puts you in the role of a Secret Service agent trying to bring order after the newly inaugurated United States President is shot on Inauguration Day.
results.name: Secret Service

results.deck: AC/DC Live is a standalone expansion for the Rock Band platform. It features 18 of the classic rock band's most popular songs, recorded live during concert. New 360 and PS3 versions contain a code that allows the songs to be imported into other Rock Band titles as DLC.
results.name: AC/DC Live: Rock Band

results.deck: A popular variant of the classic puzzle game Tetris. Falling 'tetriminos' are guided by the player to fill empty spaces to avoid reaching the top of the screen.
results.name: Tetris: The Grand Master ACE

results.deck: Action video game hero Matt Hazard returns (for the first time) in this comedic video-game-themed third-person shooter for the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3.
results.name: Eat Lead: The Return of Matt Hazard

results.deck: Raiden IV is the continuation of the bullet hell Raiden series, picking up after Raiden III. Released in 2009, it's up to the player to defeat the alien race of the Cranassians.
results.name: Raiden IV

results.deck: Presumably cancelled, Scratch: The Ultimate DJ was a game played using a turntable controller, the "Scratch Deck," designed by Numark, which promised to "allow players to re-imagine songs on the fly and add their own creativity."
results.name: Scratch: The Ultimate DJ

results.deck: Set during the events of Halo 2, Halo 3: ODST puts players as a silent Orbital Drop Shock Trooper (known as the Rookie) as he traverses through the Covenant-occupied metropolis of New Mombasa to find the whereabouts of his squadmates.
results.name: Halo 3: ODST

results.deck: Take on a living alien tower that shifts and mutates around you, and the hordes of hostile creatures that dwell within, in this infamous Japanese clone of Gears of War.
results.name: Quantum Theory

results.deck: Ninety-Nine Nights 2 is an "extreme" hack-n-slash game developed by feelplus, sequel to the 2006 release "Ninety-Nine Nights". Ninety-Nine Nights 2 was released on June 29th in North America and on July 22nd in Japan.
results.name: Ninety-Nine Nights II

results.deck: Otomedius Gorgeous is the spiritual successor to Sexy Parodius, a parody of the Gradius series. The main ingredients are Gradius, penguins, and breasts.
results.name: Otomedius Gorgeous

results.deck: MLB Front Office Manager allows the player to step into the shoes of a major league baseball general manager and take control of a baseball franchise.  The goal is to develop a perennial contender by scouting the minors, trading with other teams and even bid on players from Japan.
results.name: MLB Front Office Manager

results.deck: Cyber Troopers Virtual-On Force is the third Virtual-On game, notable for featuring 4-player battles. It is not known to have had any official release outside of Japan.
results.name: Cyber Troopers Virtual-On Force

results.deck: Dynasty Warriors 6 Empires is a stand-alone expansion to Dynasty Warriors 6.
results.name: Dynasty Warriors 6: Empires

results.deck: A 'Bullet Hell' Shoot 'Em Up game.
results.name: Deathsmiles

results.deck: 49 Sega classics packed into one huge compilation for the Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 and includes a variety of bonus material perfect for the biggest of Sega fans.
results.name: Sonic's Ultimate Genesis Collection

results.deck: A visual novel by Nitroplus and 5pb for the PC. It was later ported to the Xbox 360, PSP, and iOS devices. It's about a shut-in high school student that gets involved in a murder case and must cope with that and the errant delusions he faces.
results.name: Chäos;HEAd

results.deck: A new Dynasty Warriors game for the 360, PS3, and PSP. It features four-player co-op and a new questing system.
results.name: Dynasty Warriors: Strikeforce

results.deck: Return as Alex, Marty, Melman and Gloria as they crash and they make themselves at home in Africa in Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa
results.name: Madagascar: Escape 2 Africa

results.deck: A collection of Namco titles featuring such classics as Pac Man, Galaga, among others. Also featuring newer titles like Galaga Legions and Pac Man C.E.
results.name: Namco Museum: Virtual Arcade

results.deck: EA Sports' first tennis game slams into action on the Wii with a family-friendly art style and MotionPlus support.
results.name: Grand Slam Tennis

results.deck: A gruesome fairytale slice 'em up with blood and bunny carcasses.
results.name: Fairytale Fights

results.deck: The sequel to the Karoke Revolution Presents: American Idol. Konami and Blitz Games' Karaoke Revolution Presents: American Idol Encore 2! features a new co-op head to head mode and 40 new hit songs from the 70s on.
results.name: Karaoke Revolution Presents American Idol Encore 2

results.deck: A third-person action-horror game.
results.name: Afterfall: InSanity

results.deck: A hack and slash action game based on the 2010 film of the same name.
results.name: Clash of the Titans

results.deck: MLB 2K9 is the 2009 edition of 2K Sports' MLB 2K series.
results.name: Major League Baseball 2K9

results.deck: NPPL Championship Paintball 2009 is paintball game published by Activision. It was the first paintball game released for the current generation of consoles.
results.name: NPPL Championship Paintball 2009

results.deck: Supreme Commander 2 is the sequel to the original Supreme Commander, a real-time strategy game with a focus on massive maps and large numbers of units.
results.name: Supreme Commander 2

results.deck: EL PRESIDENTÉ! In Tropico 3, you play as a dictator on a Caribbean island trying to become as wealthy and successful as possible.
results.name: Tropico 3

results.deck: Attempt to win trophies by catching various fish.
results.name: Rapala Fishing Frenzy 2009

results.deck: DIRT 2 is part of the long-running rally-racing-series from Codemasters.
results.name: DiRT 2

results.deck: Terminator Salvation is a cover-based third-person shooter that focuses on events leading up to the film by the same name.
results.name: Terminator Salvation

results.deck: As the third installment in the Way of the Samurai franchise, you play as a Ronin wandering through feudal Japan.  Tweaks to the gameplay include a new time mechanic, increased number of swords to collect, and a new companion system.
results.name: Way of the Samurai 3

results.deck: Crash Time II features many enhancements over the previous title from the German television series. Take down troublemakers and explore the expanded environment.
results.name: Crash Time II

results.deck: Winter Sports 2: The Next Challenge is an arcade simulation featuring the most popular winter sports.
results.name: Winter Sports 2: The Next Challenge

results.deck: This is a game set in the Gundam universe that has so far only been released in Japan. It is a third/first person shooter with Battlefield-esque online multiplayer.
results.name: Mobile Suit Gundam: Operation: Troy

results.deck: Sherlock Holmes faces off against history's most notorious serial killer, Jack the Ripper, in an attempt to catch him and put an end to his vicious crimes.
results.name: Sherlock Holmes vs. Jack the Ripper

results.deck: Black College Football Experience is a college football game that also features drumline competitions that are compatible with the Rock Band drum kit.
results.name: BCFX: The Doug Williams Edition

results.deck: Following the Rock Band formula, The Beatles: Rock Band immerses players into the shoes of the Fab Four as they progress through their career, featuring an exclusively Beatles theme and song list.
results.name: The Beatles: Rock Band

results.deck: The Witcher: Rise of the White Wolf was an enhanced and expanded port of the 2007 PC only game The Witcher. Developed by Widescreen Games, the game was to have a new engine and a wealth of other differences. It has since been cancelled.
results.name: The Witcher: Rise of the White Wolf

results.deck: Movie tie-in based upon the film which was released on March 24th, 2009.
results.name: Monsters vs. Aliens

results.deck: The fifth game in the core Guitar Hero franchise, and the third in the series from Activision and Neversoft.  Though the game goes by the Guitar Hero moniker, it features full-band gameplay like its predecessor, Guitar Hero World Tour.
results.name: Guitar Hero 5

results.deck: The tenth game in the Tony Hawk series, RIDE featured the use of a newly conceived skateboard peripheral in an attempt, by Activision, to reboot the series.
results.name: Tony Hawk: RIDE

results.deck: The sequel to 2007’s wildly successful first-person-shooter Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare, Call of Duty: Modern Warfare 2 continues the story of American and British soldiers fighting Russian ultra-nationalist forces.
results.name: Modern Warfare 2

results.deck: X-Men Origins: Wolverine is a game based upon the movie of the same name that tells the early story of Wolverine.
results.name: X-Men Origins: Wolverine

results.deck: TNA iMPACT! 2 was a video game under development at Midway's Los Angeles studio anticipated for release in 2010. When the company was split up and sold, the license went to SouthPeak and the studio going to THQ, the work done on this game might never be seen.
results.name: TNA iMPACT! 2

results.deck: An open-world crime game, developed by Edge of Reality, that would have starred Snoop Dogg as a thug living in South Central L.A. The game was cancelled on March 1, 2006.
results.name: Fear & Respect

results.deck: Traverse the nine circles of hell in EA's God of War clone named after the first cycle of Dante Alighieri's epic poem The Divine Comedy.
results.name: Dante's Inferno

results.deck: A-Train HX is a train simulator on the Xbox 360. It features online support for uploading your world and trains.
results.name: A-Train HX

results.deck: Absolute: Blazing Infinity is a tactical RPG, based on the Playstation 2 game Blazing Souls.
results.name: Absolute: Blazing Infinity

results.deck: AquaZone is a fish tank simulation non-game.
results.name: AquaZone

results.deck: A party game available exclusively for the Xbox 360.
results.name: Every Party

results.deck: Japanese soccer game. Released May 17, 2006 (Japan only)
results.name: Love Football

results.deck: A first-person shooter in which a soldier from Custer's Last Stand travels through time to save important people in history from those who would meddle with the timeline for their own gain.
results.name: Darkest of Days

results.deck: Under Pressure is a third-person action adventure set on a sunken ship, where a plague has transformed most of the crew and passangers into zombies. The game is being developed by 8 people.
results.name: Under Pressure

results.deck: Ride to Hell is a motorcycle gang-land action game that follows Jake Conway and his path of revenge against the brutal biker gang called "the Devil's Hand". Infamously, it is the second game ever to get a 1.0 from GameSpot, after only the truly broken Big Rigs: Over the Road Racing.
results.name: Ride to Hell: Retribution

results.deck: A post-apocalyptic first-person shooter by Recoil Games. Put on "indefinite hold" in 2009, the game reappeared in 2012, with 3D Realms crowd-funding its development.
results.name: Earth No More

results.deck: A cancelled action RPG by Final Fantasy designer Hironobu Sakaguchi's company Mistwalker. It was first announced in 2005, and canceled in late 2008.
results.name: Cry On

results.deck: They is a unique First Person Shooter where cyborgs, aliens and terrorists have consumed modern day England, and it's up to the player to discover why they came. Development of the game is currently halted.
results.name: They

results.deck: A flight combat sim that was under development at Juice Games for PC, PS3, and Xbox 360. It was canceled due to financial troubles at would-be publisher THQ.
results.name: Stormbirds

results.deck: Harker is a canceled vampire-hunting action-adventure game that was announced in 2006. It was being developed by The Collective, which then became Double Helix Games before development was terminated.
results.name: Harker

results.deck: Turn 10's third installment in the Forza series. Forza Motorsport 3 offers 100 tracks and 400 cars with full customization, as well as video editing and uploading.
results.name: Forza Motorsport 3
